title: Shivaji
summary: Shivaji I (Shivaji Shahaji Bhonsale, Marathi pronunciation: [ʃiˈʋaːdʑiː ˈbʱos(ə)le]; c. 19 February 1630 – 3 April 1680)[6] was an Indian ruler and a member of the Bhonsle dynasty.[7] Shivaji inherited a jagir from his father who served as a retainer for the Sultanate of Bijapur, which later formed the genesis of the Maratha Kingdom. In 1674, he was formally crowned the Chhatrapati of his realm at Raigad Fort.[8]

quiz.question: What was Shivaji's date of birth?
quiz.explanation: According to the article, Shivaji was born around 19 February 1630.

quiz.question: What was the name of the fort where Shivaji was born?
quiz.explanation: The article states that Shivaji was born in the hill-fort of Shivneri, near Junnar.

quiz.question: Who was the Mughal emperor with whom Shivaji offered passage and service?
quiz.explanation: According to the article, Shivaji offered passage and service to the Mughal emperor Aurangzeb to invade the declining Sultanate of Bijapur.

quiz.question: What was the title conferred upon Shivaji by the Mughal emperor?
quiz.explanation: The article states that Shivaji was later conferred with the title of Raja by the Mughal emperor.

quiz.question: Who was the local deity after whom Shivaji was named?
quiz.explanation: The article states that Shivaji was named after a local deity, the Goddess Shivai Devi.

quiz.question: What was the name of the fort that Shivaji built using the treasure found at Torna?
quiz.explanation: According to the article, Shivaji used the treasure found at Torna to build a new fort named Rajgad.

quiz.question: Who imprisoned Shivaji's father, Shahaji, in 1648?
quiz.explanation: The article states that Shivaji's father, Shahaji, was imprisoned by a fellow Maratha sardar called Baji Ghorpade in 1648.

quiz.question: What was the name of the valley that Shivaji seized in 1656?
quiz.explanation: According to the article, Shivaji seized the valley of Javali in 1656.

quiz.question: Who was the Mughal general who defeated Shivaji in the Battle of Purandar?
quiz.explanation: The article states that Shivaji was defeated by Jai Singh I in the Battle of Purandar.

quiz.question: What was the name of the sultanate that Shivaji's father, Shahaji, served as a general?
quiz.explanation: According to the article, Shivaji's father, Shahaji, was a general of the Ahmadnagar Sultanate.
